sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: ARKO files registration statement for proposed ARKO Petroleum IPO
feed.summary: ARKO Corp. has announced the public filing of a registration statement on Form S-1 with the SEC for the proposed initial public offering of its subsidiary, ARKO Petroleum. ARKO Petroleum will operate ARKO's wholesale, fleet fueling, and GPMP segments, focusing on wholesale distribution of motor fuels to ARKO's retail convenience stores. UBS Investment Bank, Raymond James, and Stifel are lead book-running managers, with Mizuho and Capital One Securities also serving as joint book-running managers for the offering.

feed.title: ARKO files for IPO of fuel distribution subsidiary
feed.summary: ARKO Corp. has filed a registration statement with the SEC for a proposed initial public offering of its subsidiary, ARKO Petroleum Corp. This subsidiary will manage ARKO's wholesale, fleet fueling, and GPMP segments, handling the wholesale distribution of motor fuels to its retail convenience stores and other customers. The IPO's completion, size, and terms are contingent on market conditions and there is no guarantee it will be finalized.

feed.title: ARKO Petroleum, Wholesale and Fleet Fuel Distributor Supplying Dealers, Cardlock Sites, and ARKO Retail Locations Across the U.S., Files for Nasdaq IPO
feed.summary: ARKO Petroleum, a growth-focused fuel distributor, has filed for an initial public offering on Nasdaq under the ticker "APC." The company operates three segments: Wholesale, Fleet Fueling, and GPMP, supplying gasoline and diesel to over 3,000 locations across the U.S. Proceeds from the IPO will primarily be used to repay borrowings and for general corporate purposes.

feed.title: ARKO Corp. Files Registration Statement for Proposed Initial Public Offering of ARKO Petroleum Corp.
feed.summary: ARKO Corp. has filed a registration statement with the SEC for the proposed initial public offering (IPO) of its subsidiary, ARKO Petroleum Corp. This strategic move aims to enhance capital and operational focus, with ARKO Petroleum Corp. managing ARKO's wholesale, fleet fueling, and GPMP operations. UBS Investment Bank, Raymond James, and Stifel are leading the offering, though the securities cannot be sold until the registration statement becomes effective.

feed.title: ARKO Corp. Files Registration Statement for Proposed Initial Public Offering of ARKO Petroleum Corp.
feed.summary: ARKO Corp. has announced the filing of a Form S-1 registration statement with the SEC for the proposed initial public offering of its subsidiary, ARKO Petroleum Corp. (APC). This strategic move will see APC manage ARKO's wholesale, fleet fueling, and GPMP operations, focusing on motor fuel distribution. UBS Investment Bank, Raymond James, and Stifel are leading the offering for the Fortune 500 company.

feed.title: US convenience store operator moves to take its fuel supply arm public
feed.summary: ARKO Corp. has filed an S-1 registration statement for the proposed initial public offering of its subsidiary, ARKO Petroleum Corp. (APC). This new entity will consolidate ARKO’s wholesale, fleet fueling, and GPMP segments, responsible for distributing fuel to most ARKO convenience stores. UBS Investment Bank, Raymond James, and Stifel are serving as lead book-running managers for the offering, which is not yet effective.

feed.title: ARKO Corp. Announces Filing of Registration Statement for Proposed Initial Public Offering of its Subsidiary, ARKO Petroleum Corp.
feed.summary: ARKO Corp. has announced the public filing of a registration statement for the proposed initial public offering of its subsidiary, ARKO Petroleum Corp. (APC). APC will encompass ARKO's wholesale, fleet fueling, and GPMP segments, responsible for wholesale motor fuel distribution. UBS Investment Bank, Raymond James, and Stifel will serve as lead book-running managers for the offering.

feed.title: ARKO Corp Appoints Yona Fogel to Board
feed.summary: ARKO Corp announced that Steven Heyer resigned from its board due to health reasons on December 11, 2025. Yona Fogel was appointed as his replacement on December 12, 2025, bringing extensive experience in banking, energy, and industrial sectors to the company. ARKO stock currently has a Hold rating with a $5.50 price target from analysts, and TipRanks’ AI Analyst, Spark, also rates ARKO as Neutral due to a mix of strengths and challenges.

feed.title: ARKO Corp. $ARKO Shares Sold by Voss Capital LP
feed.summary: Voss Capital LP significantly reduced its stake in ARKO Corp. (NASDAQ:ARKO) during the second quarter, selling 889,599 shares, leaving it with 1.35% of ARKO. Despite this, several other institutions increased their positions, and institutional ownership remains high at 78.29%. ARKO recently missed EPS estimates, has a high debt-to-equity ratio, and pays a quarterly dividend with a 109.09% payout ratio.

feed.title: ARKO Corp. Appoints Galagher Jeff as Chief Financial Officer
feed.summary: ARKO Corp. (Nasdaq: ARKO), a Fortune 500 company and one of the largest convenience store operators and fuel wholesalers in the United States, has appointed Galagher Jeff as its Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, effective December 1, 2025. Mr. Jeff brings extensive financial leadership experience from Fortune 200 companies, including Murphy USA, Dollar Tree Stores, Advance Auto Parts, and Walmart Stores. His expertise is expected to be instrumental in advancing ARKO's growth and multi-year transformation plan.

feed.title: ARKO Corp Appoints New CFO Galagher Jeff
feed.summary: ARKO Corp. has announced the appointment of Galagher Jeff as its new Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, effective December 1, 2025. Jeff, who has a strong background from companies like Murphy USA and Walmart, will succeed Jordan Mann, who transitions to a senior strategic role. This appointment is expected to bolster ARKO Corp.'s financial leadership and operational strategy.

feed.title: ARKO Corp. Appoints Galagher Jeff as Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
feed.summary: ARKO Corp. has appointed Galagher Jeff as its new Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, effective December 1, 2025. Jeff brings extensive experience from roles at Murphy USA, Dollar Tree, and Walmart, which ARKO's CEO, Arie Kotler, believes will be instrumental in the company's growth and transformation. Jeff expressed enthusiasm for contributing to ARKO's strategic initiatives and long-term shareholder value.

feed.title: ARKO Corp Reports Q3 2025 Financial Results
feed.summary: ARKO Corp. reported a net income increase to $13.5 million in Q3 2025, up from $9.7 million in the previous year, despite a decrease in adjusted EBITDA. The company is actively focused on its transformation plan, including converting retail stores to dealer sites and expanding its network with new-to-industry locations. Analyst ratings on ARKO stock are currently a Hold with a $4.50 price target, while TipRanks’ AI Analyst suggests a Neutral outlook due to mixed financial indicators.

feed.title: ARKO Corp. (ARKO) Misses Q3 Earnings Estimates
feed.summary: ARKO Corp. (ARKO) reported Q3 earnings of $0.1 per share, missing the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $0.12, despite revenues of $2.02 billion surpassing estimates. The company's shares have underperformed the S&P 500 this year, and its Zacks Rank #3 (Hold) suggests it will perform in line with the market in the near future. The article also touches on the outlook for the Consumer Products - Staples industry and a peer company, Edgewell Personal Care (EPC).

feed.title: ARKO Corp. Announces Rise In Q3 Income
feed.summary: ARKO Corp. reported an increase in its third-quarter profit, rising to $12.01 million or $0.10 per share, up from $8.23 million or $0.07 per share in the previous year. Despite the profit growth, the company's revenue for the same period declined by 11.4% to $2.020 billion.

feed.title: ARKO (NASDAQ:ARKO) Stock Price Down 1.8% - Should You Sell?
feed.summary: ARKO Corp.'s stock price dropped by 1.8% to $4.40, with trading volume slightly below average. Analysts have a consensus price target of $7.13 for ARKO, with mixed ratings ranging from "Strong Buy" to "Sell." Institutional investors and hedge funds hold a significant 78.29% ownership of ARKO's shares, indicating strong interest despite varying analyst outlooks.

feed.title: People on the Move: ARKO Corp., Johnson Brothers & Rhodes Convenience Stores
feed.summary: This article details recent executive changes and personnel announcements across various companies in the convenience store industry. Key moves include Robb Giammatteo departing as CFO of ARKO Corp., Soraya Benchikh stepping down as CFO of British American Tobacco, and new appointments at CandyRific, Convenience Distribution Association, Johnson Brothers, JPalmer Collective, Motion Technology Inc., and Rhodes Convenience Stores, as well as an award from LOMCSA. These changes reflect ongoing strategic adjustments and leadership transitions within the sector.

feed.title: ARKO Corp. Announces Departure of CFO Robb Giammatteo, Plans for Transition Ahead
feed.summary: ARKO Corp. announced that CFO Robb Giammatteo is leaving the company for a new opportunity outside the convenience store sector, effective October 10, 2025. CEO Arie Kotler praised Giammatteo's significant contributions to the transformation plan and the finance department's strengthening. Giammatteo will remain in his role until the specified date to ensure a smooth transition, expressing pride in the team's achievements and excitement for ARKO's continued progress.

feed.title: ARKO Corp. Opens Second fas craves Location in Mechanicsville, Virginia, Enhancing Customer Experience with Innovative Food Offerings
feed.summary: ARKO Corp. has opened its second fas craves convenience store location in Mechanicsville, Virginia, focusing on an innovative food-first concept to enhance customer experience. The store, which opened on August 6, 2025, offers a variety of hot and cold grab-n-go items and will host a grand opening celebration with special promotions from September 17-30. This expansion reflects ARKO's strategy to transform the convenience store experience with elevated food options and integrate customer loyalty programs.

feed.title: ARKO Corp. Announces Conference Call to Discuss Q2 2025 Financial Results
feed.summary: ARKO Corp., a Fortune 500 company and leading convenience store operator, announced it will host a conference call on August 6, 2025, at 5:00 p.m. Eastern Time. The call is to discuss its financial results for the second quarter ended June 30, 2025, and will include a Q&A session. Financial results will be released via press release prior to the call, with a webcast and replay available for participants.

feed.title: Wells Fargo Initiates ARKO Corp(ARKO.US) With Hold Rating, Announces Target Price $4.5
feed.summary: Wells Fargo has initiated coverage on ARKO Corp (ARKO.US) with a "hold" rating and set a target price of $4.5. Analyst Edward Kelly, who has a 64.0% success rate and an 8.5% average return over the past year according to TipRanks, made the recommendation. This information serves as an analyst rating and not investment advice.

feed.title: Arko begins building food-focused stores, will debut new foodservice program
feed.summary: Arko Corp., parent of GPM Investments, has begun building its first food-focused convenience store in Richmond, Virginia, featuring a new foodservice program called Fas Craves. This is the initial step in developing seven pilot stores by the end of 2025, each costing between $700,000 and $1.1 million, as part of Arko's long-term transformation plan emphasizing organic growth and store-level investments. The company aims to evaluate these pilots before a broader rollout in 2026.

feed.title: Capital One Financial Initiates ARKO Corp(ARKO.US) With Buy Rating, Announces Target Price $8
feed.summary: Capital One Financial has initiated coverage on ARKO Corp (ARKO.US) with a "Buy" rating and set a target price of $8. Analyst Dan Guglielmo, who has a 44.4% success rate and -8.4% average return over the past year according to TipRanks, provided this new rating. The article clarifies that TipRanks data is based on independent third-party analysis and should not be considered investment advice.

feed.title: GPM Investments to settle lawsuit
feed.summary: GPM Investments has agreed to settle a lawsuit with the family of a former employee, Pam Smotherman, who was murdered during an armed robbery in 2020. The retailer had previously opposed a $5.5 million settlement awarded to the family, citing “evident partiality” from the arbitrator. Details of the settlement have not been disclosed, and GPM Investments was unreachable for comment.

feed.title: GPM Investments battling $5.5M wrongful death settlement
feed.summary: GPM Investments, the c-store arm of Arko Corp., is fighting to overturn a $5.5 million settlement it was ordered to pay after one of its clerks was murdered during an overnight shift in July 2020. The company is arguing "evident partiality" and that the arbitrator "exceeded his authority" in deciding the case's outcome. Smotherman's family sued GPM for negligence and wrongful death, claiming the retailer did not follow its own safety policies, leading to a foreseeable robbery and murder.

feed.title: Morris Willner Resigns as Director from Board of Directors of Arko Corp
feed.summary: Morris Willner has resigned from the Board of Directors of ARKO Corp., effective January 1, 2024. His resignation was attributed to health reasons and not due to any disagreements with the company's operations, policies, or practices.

feed.title: ARKO Corp. Announces New Financial Arrangements That Create More Than $2 Billion in Capital
feed.summary: ARKO Corp. announced new financial arrangements, including a third amendment to its program agreement with Oak Street and a renewed, extended revolving credit facility with Capital One, increasing its credit line by $300 million to $800 million. These agreements provide ARKO with over $2 billion in available capital for continued merger and acquisition activity and long-term growth, as the company emphasizes disciplined and accretive transactions in the convenience store sector. This follows recent acquisition attempts and successful purchases of multiple convenience store portfolios.

feed.title: TravelCenters of America puts BP merger drama to bed
feed.summary: TravelCenters of America (TA) has solidified its $1.3 billion acquisition deal with BP, clearing major hurdles despite a last-minute bid from ARKO Corp. TA's Board of Directors reaffirmed its recommendation for shareholders to approve the BP merger, citing ARKO's problematic financing and execution risk from a past deal. The shareholder vote is scheduled for May 10, with the acquisition expected to close on May 15.

feed.title: GPM Completes Acquisition of Quarles Assets
feed.summary: GPM Investments LLC, a subsidiary of ARKO Corp., has finalized the acquisition of certain assets from Quarles Petroleum Inc., which includes 121 proprietary cardlock sites, management of 63 third-party cardlock sites, 46 independent dealer locations, and a small transportation fleet. This marks ARKO's 21st acquisition since 2013, with the deal expected to add approximately $17.5 million of adjusted EBITDA annually and about 160 million gallons of fuel sales. The acquisition signifies Quarles Petroleum's complete exit from the petroleum marketing industry.

feed.title: ARKO Finalizes Acquisition of Quarles Petroleum Assets
feed.summary: ARKO Corp. subsidiary GPM Investments LLC has finalized its acquisition of Quarles Petroleum Inc.'s fueling cardlock and fuel distribution business, just five months after the initial announcement. This strategic acquisition includes 121 proprietary Quarles-branded cardlock sites, management of 63 third-party sites, 46 independent dealer locations, and a transportation fleet, aiming to add approximately 160 million gallons to ARKO's annual sales. The deal is expected to contribute around $17.5 million of adjusted EBITDA annually and represents ARKO's 21st acquisition since 2013, reinforcing its focus on long-term shareholder value and growth.

feed.title: ARKO Corp. Appoints Ross Parman to Lead Investor Relations and Government Affairs
feed.summary: ARKO Corp. (Nasdaq: ARKO) has announced the appointment of Ross Parman as Vice President of Investor Relations and Government Affairs. Parman, previously Director of Communications for Altria, will manage investor and corporate communications, including relationships with investors and sell-side analysts for the 6th largest convenience store chain in the U.S. This strategic hire aims to enhance ARKO's engagement with its growing investor base as it completes its first full year as a U.S. public company.

feed.title: Handy Mart Sells Chain to GPM
feed.summary: GPM Investments LLC has acquired E.J. Pope & Son Inc., dba Handy Mart, which includes 36 convenience stores in North Carolina, with 20 featuring quick-service restaurants or proprietary food offerings. This marks Arko's 20th acquisition since 2013, expanding GPM's presence in the Carolinas to a total of 3,100 stores. Matrix Capital Markets Group Inc. advised E.J. Pope & Son on the sale.

feed.title: GPM Acquires Handy Mart
feed.summary: GPM Investments LLC, a subsidiary of ARKO Corp., has acquired the Handy Mart chain, including 36 convenience stores in North Carolina and one development parcel from E.J. Pope & Son Inc. This marks GPM's 20th acquisition since 2013, expanding its presence in the Carolinas and increasing its total store count to approximately 3,100 locations. E.J. Pope & Son Inc. was advised by Matrix Capital Markets Group Inc. on the sale.

feed.title: Arko Rising
feed.summary: Haymaker Acquisition Corp. II and Arko Holdings Ltd. have completed their business combination, forming Arko Corp., which will trade on Nasdaq under ARKO and ARKOW. Arko's CEO, Arie Kotler, emphasized the company's growth platform for acquisitions and organic opportunities within the fragmented convenience store industry. GPM Investments, a key asset of Arko, operates approximately 3,000 locations across 33 states and Washington D.C., and is planning to maintain its community brands under the new company.
